title: MUSIC GEN_MUS 175-0-20 Selected Topics in Music Literature for Non-Majors

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course takes as its premise that music is a cultural object deeply connected to its political environment, and asks how music in a variety of genres has worked in service of, or in opposition to, political forces throughout history. Among others, case studies to be examined will include: Music and Propaganda in the Renaissance Italian Court; Music and the Reformation; Music and Nationalism; Music under a Totalitarian State; Protest Music and Civil Rights in the 1960s; and Beyoncé's Lemonade. This reading-intensive course will also include weekly listening assignments, weekly Canvas discussion board entries, a midterm, student-led discussion, and a final research project. No prior musical experience is required: Musicians and non-musicians alike are welcome.
